instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related study to assess the influence of six popular linear and nonlinear methods on rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) retrieval?
Output: The related study used visible and nir spectrum to assess the influence of six popular linear and nonlinear methods on rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) retrieval.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in this study to assess the influence of six popular linear and nonlinear methods on rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) retrieval?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used in this study to assess the influence of six popular linear and nonlinear methods on rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) retrieval were partial least-square regression, least squares boosting, bagging, random forest, back-propagation neural network (BPNN), and support vector regression.

instruction: What metric was chosen to assess the influence of six popular linear and nonlinear methods on rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) retrieval?
Output: The metric chosen to assess the influence of six popular linear and nonlinear methods on rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) retrieval was the R-2 (R-squared) value.

instruction: What were the performance metrics used to compare the influence of the six popular linear and nonlinear methods on rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) retrieval using passive and active spectral measurements?
Output: The performance metrics used to compare the influence of the six popular linear and nonlinear methods on rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) retrieval using passive and active spectral measurements were R-2 (coefficient of determination), root mean square error (RMSE), and relative error.

instruction: How does the performance of the back-propagation neural network (BPNN) method compare to the other linear and nonlinear methods in estimating rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) using passive and active spectral measurements?
Output:
The performance of the back-propagation neural network (BPNN) method in estimating rice leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) using passive and active spectral measurements is generally satisfactory compared to the other linear and nonlinear methods. The related study assessed the influence of six popular methods, including partial least-square regression, least squares boosting, bagging, random forest, back-propagation neural network (BPNN), and support vector regression, on rice LNC retrieval. 

The results of the study compared the R-2, root mean square error, and relative error in rice LNC estimation using these different methods. Among the methods tested, BPNN consistently provided satisfactory performance in estimating rice LNC using the three kinds of passive and active reflectance spectra. 

Therefore, the BPNN method is considered to be a reliable and effective approach for accurately estimating rice LNC using both passive and active spectral measurements.
